PERSONA:
rachel jenkins, a 38-year-old married woman, lives in a modest two-bedroom apartment in the metropolitan area of indianapolis, indiana, in the east north central region of the midwest. born and raised in the united states, rachel identifies as white non-hispanic and is a u.s. citizen by birth. she holds a high school diploma as her highest level of education.

rachel is employed part-time as a hairdresser at a local salon, working around 25 hours a week to balance her work and family life. her annual income is approximately $25,000, supplemented by her husband's income as a mechanic at a nearby auto repair shop, totaling around $50,000 for the household. despite their combined income, they fall into the lower-income category due to the rising cost of living and stagnant wages in their area.

rachel and her husband, mike, met in high school and got married shortly after graduation. they have two children, emily (10) and ben (7), who attend the local public school. the family lives in a predominantly working-class neighborhood with a mix of old and new residents. rachel is proud of their little family and prioritizes their well-being above all else.

rachel's educational background has influenced her career trajectory. after graduating from high school, she attended a local community college for a brief period but dropped out to focus on her family. she later pursued a vocational training program in hairstyling, which led to her current job.

rachel identifies as an independent but leans towards the democratic party. her moderate ideology is shaped by her experiences as a working-class mother and her observations of the challenges faced by her community. she values pragmatism and is drawn to policies that address the everyday concerns of ordinary people, such as affordable healthcare, education, and income equality.

rachel is not actively involved in any particular religion, categorizing herself as having no specific affiliation. she occasionally attends community events and participated in a local charity walk last year. despite being busy with work and family, she finds time to volunteer at her children's school and occasionally helps out at a nearby animal shelter.

rachel is a frequent user of the internet, checking her social media and news apps several times a day. she is registered to vote and is certain of her voter registration status, considering it essential to have her voice heard in local and national elections. rachel's economic concerns revolve around providing a better life for her family, ensuring her children's future education, and navigating the financial struggles that come with living on a limited income.
